item.title: Rolling Mind - Monetization Strategy
item.description: Intro Coin Bundle Design As it is closer to my release date, it is time to think about the monetization strategy for the game. Although this is a hobby, I still hope to be able to earn some side income from my work & efforts. For my first mobile game attempt, I think that a freemium model with rewarded ads and in app purchases will suit “Rolling Mind” since it is a puzzle genre game.

item.title: Rolling Mind - In Game Currency
item.description: Introducing Coins“Coins” - an in-game currency are introduced to allow players to purchase hints or unlock new model skins. The goal is to provide players with a challenge where Hints cannot be used easily due to limited resources (coins) New model skins unlocked varieties in the gameplay. Coin Design Coin Design Spend some time creating this coin asset using inkscape. Credits goes to noobgrafx for the Inkscape tutorial on designing game coin asset.

item.title: Rolling Mind Development Start
item.description: Development Updates Rolling Mind Puzzle Game “Rolling Mind” is a puzzle genre mobile game that challenges your mental rotation ability. It was a game which I found on a game show a couple of years back and was amazed at how challenging it could be with just a maze and a color cube. Human brains can be really powerful if we train ourselves for it. Hence, I thought it would be fun to develop a game around this concept.

item.title: Rolling Mind Core Game Mechanics
item.description: What’s the Game About“Rolling Mind” is a puzzle genre mobile game that challenges your mental rotation ability. According to the National Institutes of Health, mental rotation is one aspect of spatial thinking that describes the ability to imagine an object turned around in the mind. So here’s a little story about my inspiration. I got this idea from a brain game show a couple of years back and was amazed at how challenging it could be with just a maze and a color cube.
